alert.note: Alert for Dallas (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 24 at 10:35PM CDT until May 25 at 12:11PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave affecting Dallas County. For the Headwater Forecasts...including Everman, Arlington, Marys Creek, Cleburne, Cleburne, White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave, Garland, Grand Prairie Alert 10, Grand Prairie, Gainesville, Haltom City, Kaufman, Mansfield, Sachse...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White Rock Creek Near White Rock Creek At Greenville Ave. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 88.0 feet, Moderate flooding will occur along the creek. Ball fields at Moss Park are completely flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 85.6 feet. - Flood stage is 84.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 86.1 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
